page.title: 11THE TYNESIDE METRO
page.content: The Tyne and Wear Metro System was officially opened by Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II on 6th Nov.1981.It is a system of transport that is unique in Britain. Metro trains run at intervals of 5 or 10 minutes along both banks of the River Tyne serving the towns situated there.In Central Newcastle and Gateshead there is a 3 minute frequency of service. Each twin-car unit is capable of carrying 84 passengers seated and 188 standing. They are powered by electricity from overhead lines at 1500 volts and have a maximum speed of 80k.p.h.(50m.p.h.).At the same time as the Metro was opened,most of the bus routes in Tyne and Wear were altered so that the buses now 'feed' the Metro stations and it is hoped that passengers will use the Metro for the main part of their journey.
